text: When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

When you are 28, to your luck, scientists discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating a theoretical immortality. While aging is stopped, scientists stress that those that take the drug are still at risk of other causes of death.  Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

When you are 28, to your luck, scientists discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating a theoretical immortality. While aging is stopped, scientists stress that those that take the drug are still at risk of other causes of death. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. What risks they suggest, where never truly told to you or the rest of the older population, who over time aged while the younger population remained young. You lived with bitter resentment, watching as your body slowly deteriorated and become slower, as the fear of your own mortality slowly  When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

When you are 28, to your luck, scientists discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating a theoretical immortality. While aging is stopped, scientists stress that those that take the drug are still at risk of other causes of death. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. What risks they suggest, where never truly told to you or the rest of the older population, who over time aged while the younger population remained young. You lived with bitter resentment, watching as your body slowly deteriorated and become slower, as the fear of your own mortality slowly grew with each passing year. To your surprise, when you are 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

When you are 28, to your luck, scientists discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating a theoretical immortality. While aging is stopped, scientists stress that those that take the drug are still at risk of other causes of death. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. What risks they suggest, where never truly told to you or the rest of the older population, who over time aged while the younger population remained young. You lived with bitter resentment, watching as your body slowly deteriorated and become slower, as the fear of your own mortality slowly grew with each passing year. To your surprise, when you are 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

"The drug had been designed to stop aging, but it had a side effect that was not discovered until it was too late.

When you are 28, to your luck, scientists discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating a theoretical immortality. While aging is stopped, scientists stress that those that take the drug are still at risk of other causes of death. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. What risks they suggest, where never truly told to you or the rest of the older population, who over time aged while the younger population remained young. You lived with bitter resentment, watching as your body slowly deteriorated and become slower, as the fear of your own mortality slowly grew with each passing year. To your surprise, when you are 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

The drug had been designed to stop aging, but it had a side effect that was not discovered until it was too late. Scientists were baffled at the side effect, and rushed to quickly determine a cure. You were watching the news when you first heard of the first case of such a side effect being observed, a young man, who looked no older than 22, who lapsed into a deep coma.

When you are 28, to your luck, scientists discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating a theoretical immortality. While aging is stopped, scientists stress that those that take the drug are still at risk of other causes of death. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. What risks they suggest, where never truly told to you or the rest of the older population, who over time aged while the younger population remained young. You lived with bitter resentment, watching as your body slowly deteriorated and become slower, as the fear of your own mortality slowly grew with each passing year. To your surprise, when you are 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

The drug had been designed to stop aging, but it had a side effect that was not discovered until it was too late. Scientists were baffled at the side effect, and rushed to quickly determine a cure. You were watching the news when you first heard of the first case of such a side effect being observed, a young man, who looked no older than 22, who lapsed into a deep coma.

It was determined that while aging was reversed, given time, the body would soon slow down all bodily processes, placing the person into a deep sleep. It was determined that such a side effect took a significant amount of time, but seemed to coincide with people aging into their 70s and 80s, if they didn't take the drug.

You lived with bitter resentment, watching as your body slowly deteriorated and become slower, as the fear of your own mortality slowly grew with each passing year. To your surprise, when you are 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

You were watching the news when you first heard of the first case of such a side effect being observed, a young man, who looked no older than 22, who lapsed into a deep coma.

It was determined that while aging was reversed, given time, the body would soon slow down all bodily processes, placing the person into a deep sleep. It was determined that such a side effect took a significant amount of time, but seemed to coincide with people aging into their 70s and 80s, if they didn't take the drug. The drug was quickly recalled, and the government began to investigate the cause of the side effect.

When you are 28, to your luck, scientists discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating a theoretical immortality. While aging is stopped, scientists stress that those that take the drug are still at risk of other causes of death. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. What risks they suggest, where never truly told to you or the rest of the older population, who over time aged while the younger population remained young. You lived with bitter resentment, watching as your body slowly deteriorated and become slower, as the fear of your own mortality slowly grew with each passing year. To your surprise, when you are 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

The drug had been designed to stop aging, but it had a side effect that was not discovered until it was too late. Scientists were baffled at the side effect, and rushed to quickly determine a cure. You were watching the news when you first heard of the first case of such a side effect being observed, a young man, who looked no older than 22, who lapsed into a deep coma.

It was determined that while aging was reversed, given time, the body would soon slow down all bodily processes, placing the person into a deep sleep. It was determined that such a side effect took a significant amount of time, but seemed to coincide with people aging into their 70s and 80s, if they didn't take the drug. The drug was quickly recalled, and governments around the world began to investigate a potential cure. 

Hospitals around the world filled with patients who had taken the drug many years ago. Although they were still alive, they were unresponsive and unaware of their surroundings, seeminlgy trapped in a deep sleep.

When you are 28, to your luck, scientists discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating a theoretical immortality. While aging is stopped, scientists stress that those that take the drug are still at risk of other causes of death. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. What risks they suggest, where never truly told to you or the rest of the older population, who over time aged while the younger population remained young. You lived with bitter resentment, watching as your body slowly deteriorated and become slower, as the fear of your own mortality slowly grew with each passing year. To your surprise, when you are 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

The drug had been designed to stop aging, but it had a side effect that was not discovered until it was too late. Scientists were baffled at the side effect, and rushed to quickly determine a cure. You were watching the news when you first heard of the first case of such a side effect being observed, a young man, who looked no older than 22, who lapsed into a deep coma.

It was determined that while aging was reversed, given time, the body would soon slow down all bodily processes, placing the person into a deep sleep. It was determined that such a side effect took a significant amount of time, but seemed to coincide with people aging into their 70s and 80s, if they didn't take the drug. The drug was quickly recalled, and governments around the world began to investigate a potential cure. 

Hospitals around the world filled with patients who had taken the drug many years ago. Although they were still alive, they were unresponsive and unaware of their surroundings, seemingly trapped in a deep sleep. You wonder what they might be dreaming of, if they were even in a dream at all. At 85, you pondered your own mortality, would an afterlife exist for you and everyone else that had not taken the drug and would eventually die of old age?

You lived with bitter resentment, watching as your body slowly deteriorated and become slower, as the fear of your own mortality slowly grew with each passing year. It was determined that while aging was reversed, given time, the body would soon slow down all bodily processes, placing the person into a deep sleep. It was determined that such a side effect took a significant amount of time, but seemed to coincide with people aging into their 70s and 80s, if they didn't take the drug. The drug was quickly recalled, and governments around the world began to investigate a potential cure.

At 85, you pondered your own mortality, would an afterlife exist for you and everyone else that had not taken the drug and would eventually die of old age? 

The scientists were able to determine a cure, but it was not without its own side effects.

When you are 28, to your luck, scientists discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating a theoretical immortality. While aging is stopped, scientists stress that those that take the drug are still at risk of other causes of death. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. What risks they suggest, where never truly told to you or the rest of the older population, who over time aged while the younger population remained young. You lived with bitter resentment, watching as your body slowly deteriorated and become slower, as the fear of your own mortality slowly grew with each passing year. To your surprise, when you are 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

The drug had been designed to stop aging, but it had a side effect that was not discovered until it was too late. Scientists were baffled at the side effect, and rushed to quickly determine a cure. You were watching the news when you first heard of the first case of such a side effect being observed, a young man, who looked no older than 22, who lapsed into a deep coma.

It was determined that while aging was reversed, given time, the body would soon slow down all bodily processes, placing the person into a deep sleep. It was determined that such a side effect took a significant amount of time, but seemed to coincide with people aging into their 70s and 80s, if they didn't take the drug. The drug was quickly recalled, and governments around the world began to investigate a potential cure. 

Hospitals around the world filled with patients who had taken the drug many years ago. Although they were still alive, they were unresponsive and unaware of their surroundings, seemingly trapped in a deep sleep. You wonder what they might be dreaming of, if they were even in a dream at all. At 85, you pondered your own mortality, would an afterlife exist for you and everyone else that had not taken the drug and would eventually die of old age? For once in your life, you felt a bitter acceptance of your mortality. Although it was possible the world and its scientists may find a cure for those affected by the drug, you felt glad that you didn't take it all those many years ago. For scientists had cured the aging process, but it came at a great cost to its many users of the world. It robbed them of a potential afterlife, an existence that transcended that what is perceived in the harsh reality of the world. In their coma, you thought, they would live in their own type of reality, unconnected to others. That is a fate you felt would be worse than death, a prolonged existence that might not even allow them to see or make sense of what is occurring to them. With that, you spent the rest of your life amongst your friends and family, content to spend what time you have left still in this world.
